com.oceanoptics.omnidriver.features.throughput

Interface Throughput


  • public interface Throughput
    This provides an interface for managing the buffer and how many spectrums are combined together in one transaction. It is assumed that retrieval of the actual data elements is managed elsewhere.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clearBuffer()
      Causes the data buffer to immediately flush its contents and go back to an empty state.

      Get the back to back setting of the device.

      This method will query the state of the buffer enable from the device if possible.

      Convenience method for getting integration time.

      Get the number of spectrum represented by the count.

      Convenience method for setting integration time.

      Sets the total number of spectrum expected to receive in one transactional packet.

    • Method Detail

      • setSpectraCount

        void setSpectraCount(int value)
        Sets the total number of spectrum expected to receive in one transactional packet. This value is used in conjunction or as an argument to 'Get raw spectrum with meta data.
        Parameters:
        value - The number of spectrum that will appear in one packet return.

      • getBufferEnable

        boolean getBufferEnable()
                 throws java.io.IOException
        This method will query the state of the buffer enable from the device if possible. It will attempt to give the last commanded value or a default value if the device cannot be queried and no state has been commanded yet. Note that in this case the result may be incorrect.
        Returns:
        Whether the buffer enable has been asserted
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if there is an error when attempting to execute the command

      • setBufferEnable

        void setBufferEnable(boolean enable)
              throws java.io.IOException
        This method will attempt to set the state of buffer enable.
        Parameters:
        enable - Whether to assert or de-assert the buffer enable signal
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if there is an error when attempting to execute the command

      • clearBuffer

        void clearBuffer()
          throws java.io.IOException
        Causes the data buffer to immediately flush its contents and go back to an empty state.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if there is any problem commanding the device to clear its data buffer

      • setB2BCapacity

        void setB2BCapacity(int bufferSize)
             throws java.io.IOException
        Sets the number of back to back data elements that the buffer should store. Once the buffer reaches capacity, new data may be discarded or overwrite existing entries according to the device's settings. Note that setting the buffer size may cause some or all data in the buffer to be discarded. allowed to store at once. Note that this must not exceed the value given by getBufferCapacityMaximum.
        Parameters:
        bufferSize - the buffer limit.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if there is a problem setting the limit.

      • getB2BCapacity

        int getB2BCapacity()
            throws java.io.IOException
        Get the back to back setting of the device.
        Returns:
        number of back-to-back setting
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if there is a problem setting the limit.

      • requestSpectrumWithMetaData

        void requestSpectrumWithMetaData(int count)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Request from 1 to 15 spectrum from device. Note: if buffer is set true, the amount requested is not guaranteed.
        Parameters:
        count - number of spectrum desired.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an error occurs.

      • getSpectrumWithMetaData

        OBPSpectrum[] getSpectrumWithMetaData(int count)
                               throws java.io.IOException
        Get the number of spectrum represented by the count. Note: if the buffer is set true, the amount of spectrum returned is not guaranteed.
        Parameters:
        count - number of spectrum desired.
        Returns:
        array of spectrum with meta data.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an error occurs.

      • setIntegration

        void setIntegration(int time)
             throws java.io.IOException
        Convenience method for setting integration time. Note: this can be called from the Wrapper class with the exact same effect.
        Parameters:
        time - integration time in microseconds.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an error occurs.

      • getIntegration

        int getIntegration()
            throws java.io.IOException
        Convenience method for getting integration time. Note: this can be called from the Wrapper class with the exact same effect.
        Returns:
        integration time in microseconds.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an error occurs.
